meanings.definition: The apparent displacement of an object when viewed from different positions.
meanings.sent1: The parallax of the tree made it seem like it was moving as I walked past.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use parallax to understand how stars appear to shift in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The parallax of the painting created a fun optical illusion for visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her changing perspective on life was like a parallax, shifting with each new experience.
meanings.sent5: The parallax of the mountain range against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The difference in the apparent position of an object when viewed along two different lines of sight.
meanings.sent1: The parallax between the two photographs showed how angles can change perception.
meanings.sent2: A telescope can detect parallax in stars to determine their distance from Earth.
meanings.sent3: The parallax in the mirror made her reflection seem like it was waving.
meanings.sent4: The parallax in opinions between the two friends created a rift in their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The parallax of the moon against the night sky was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To measure the distance to a star by observing its parallax.
meanings.sent1: Astronomers parallax stars to calculate their distance from Earth.
meanings.sent2: They will parallax the star tonight to determine its location in the galaxy.
meanings.sent3: I tried to parallax the tree's height by looking at it from different angles.
meanings.sent4: She will parallax the building's height by measuring its shadow at noon.
meanings.sent5: The scientist will parallax the comet's trajectory to predict its path.
